Amazing game! The story is fantastic, gameplay is fantastic, the whole game is just... fantastic! It's miles above the original Portal game. I would recommend this to anyone!

Portal 2 is a great game, easy to see how it is perennially at the top of the Steam best reviewed games. It has one of the most engaging stories ever told in a puzzle game. It has an appropriate length and a ton of very clever puzzles to solve. 10/10 will play again in a decade :)

Still the best puzzle game I've ever played. Portal mechanics never fail to please.

Literally the best game I've ever played
I am making this review because I need steam awards to feed my poor 3 starving children.
I love this game it delivered what i was expecting, it is by far the better game of the Portal series by story and gameplay.

This game is REALLY fun!  I would recommend it to anyone who has played the first Portal game, any of the Half-Life games, or anyone who just really likes puzzles.  In this game, you play as Chell, a mute human being guided by Weatley, a friendly AI.  The object of the game is to escape the Aperture Science testing facility, being run by the evil AI Glados, who wants nothing more than to force the player to complete various tests until the player is killed.  There is also a cooperative mode in which you complete cooperative tests as one of two robots (Atlas or P-Body) designed to replace the human element in Glados' tests.  You do not need to play the first game before playing this one, as everything you would need to know is explained in the game. 
 However keep in mind that if you play the games out of order the second game will spoil a bit of the ending of the first.  :)  Sorry that this is so long!

[h1] Thrilling Game. [/h1]


[b] I've had Portal 1 and 2 for a couple of years now, both unfinished. So i found the time now to actually start both over and finish them. And gosh it was totally worth it. [/b]


The story has a big plot twist, the gameplay is simply unique. The levels are difficult at some point, but always doable. It has many little details to explore and many achievements some of which are hidden in a genious way. All characters you meet have their own personality that even changes over the plot, you really feel to be in the game.
And the Multiplayer is the dot on the i of all this.

One of the best games I have ever played (in combination with part 1), 10/10 recommended.
Portal 2, while not as classic as the first iteration, is still a very good game. It improves on the characters by making them more lively and the gameplay is still as timeless as ever
